Good point. In this case, however, there is a wealth of test files (the
backup PDBs from my Visor) which I can use to validate the object model.

But the idea is still the same - read/write/compare or write/read/compare.
Are these the only tests you do for this kind of behavior?

-----Original Message-----
From: Mark Meyers [mailto:markm@...]
Sent: Tuesday, 12 February, 2002 3:22
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] testing file readers



> I'm writing classes to read Palm PDB files into Java objects.
> ...is reading a file into the object model, writing it back to a
> file, and doing a file compare.

I do it the other way round.
Create a java object, store it in an XML file, reading it back, creating
another instance, then compare the two instances. Much easier to compare
java objects than text files.

subject: RE: [junit] testing file readers
